activities: Mentor Worldwide LLC receives personal information in various forms relating to European personnel, including prospective and former employees.  Data transferred from the European Union to the United States are used to carry out the company’s human resources functions. In addition, Mentor receives personal information about its customers and consumers in support of customer service, compliant handling/adverse event functions.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Human Resources and Complaint Handling/Adverse Events.
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) (for human resources data); JAMs (for all other data)
